content.short_description: Engineered with the flexibility to perform anywhere in the room — even behind furniture — the Acousta Quarter Wave delivers true hi-fi without dominating your space.
content.long_description:
The Acousta Quarter Wave proves that high fidelity need not command attention to be exceptional. Its ingenious rear-horn design produces clean, articulate bass with signature Lowther clarity, even when positioned behind furniture or discreetly in a corner. Handmade in Great Britain and finished in bespoke veneers carefully matched to each living space, it is as beautiful as fine furniture yet unassuming in its presence.

At its heart lies the PM7A Philharmonic, renowned for warmth, speed and natural detail. Together, cabinet and instrument create a performance that rivals, and often surpasses, systems many times its size. Every pair carries a 10-year warranty and the assurance of a lifetime of listening pleasure.

Offered exclusively with the Lowther Field Coil or PM4A Philharmonic, it delivers breathtaking immediacy and scale, revealing the full emotional weight of music with absolute control and refinement. Each cabinet is handcrafted from Baltic Birch and finished in hand-matched veneers, achieving both resonance control and beauty in form. Built to commission, Hegeman represents the pinnacle of British artisanal engineering and a lifelong connection to musical truth.

content.short_description: A historic horn loudspeaker of monumental presence and sculptural grace. The 4ft Voigt Horn is Lowther's most iconic expression of single-driver artistry.
content.long_description:
In the 1920s, Paul Voigt created a horn loudspeaker that would become the foundation of modern Hi‑Fi.

The Voigt horn captures more than sound. It represents a moment in time when Great Britain was at the forefront of both engineering and creativity. From this single design grew a world of Hi‑Fi that changed the way people experienced music forever.

Our 2024 reproduction honours that original moment. Handcrafted in Britain, the horn is designed for the Field Coil Philharmonic drive unit, pairing Voigt's pioneering form with Lowther's most coveted instrument.

The result is both a tribute and a continuation: a timeless union of past and present. This is not just a loudspeaker - it is a piece of Hi‑Fi history, a moment in time, preserved in an eternity of music.
